summary: An encrypted email from February 12, 2020, regarding Airline Reporting Corporation (ARC) records, with attachments including an FBI subpoena from the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York dated January 30, 2020. The email appears to be part of a law enforcement investigation into travel records.

persons.name: MM (NY) (FBI)

events.title: Encrypted Email Regarding ARC Records
events.description: An encrypted email was sent discussing Airline Reporting Corporation (ARC) records, with attachments including the FBI subpoena.

locations: U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The email is encrypted, indicating sensitive or confidential content related to the Epstein investigation.
Attachments include an FBI subpoena from the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York dated January 30, 2020, seeking Airline Reporting Corporation (ARC) records.
ARC records are used to track airline travel, which could be relevant for investigating the movements of individuals associated with Jeffrey Epstein.
The email involves FBI personnel, suggesting ongoing federal law enforcement activity in early 2020.
The document is part of a data set released in relation to the Epstein case, highlighting the use of travel records in the investigation.
